intro: Sarcocephalus coadunatus, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and oval, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into fleshy, red berries containing numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in coastal forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
